project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-3278].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

1. Add Time Tracking and Log Work to the Default Screen, the Workflow Screen, and the Resolve Issue Screen.
2. Create a new issue, e.g., A-1.
3. Set its original estimate to any non-zero amount, e.g. 1h.
4. Create a filter, key = A-1, save it as A-1 Filter.
5. Create a dashboard, add the Agile Gadget, set its filter to A-1 Filter.
6. On the gadget's Info tab, set the date range so that it includes today.
7. Observe that the Info tab and the Hours tab report 1h remaining.
8. Resolve A-1. On the Resolve Issue Screen, set the remaining time to 0h.
9. Observe that the gadget's Info and the Hours tab report 0h remaining. This is what I expect so far.
10. Reopen the issue. On the Workflow Screen, set the remaining time to 3h.
11. Observe that the Info tab reports 3h remaining; observe that the Hours tab still incorrectly reports 0h remaining. I would expect that the Hours tab would report 3h remaining.

I originally raised this issue in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-80718
fields.summary: Agile Gadget Hours Chart shows more remaining hours than Info tab and underlying data show, after setting remaining time on reopen.

fields.description: When I try to modify the settings of an existing Progress Project gadget (the red-yellow-green bar for wallboards & dashboards) or the cumulative flow gadget, often the form is truncated, with part of the form below the display window. There is no scroll bar to see the rest of the options or submit. I usually have to either delete it and add a new one, or drag it around on the page till the whole form appears, change the values and submit, and drag it back to where it needs to be.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

*Scenario 1*
# Create an issue at 15/6/2011 with Original Estimate 10h. 
# Log 2h work at 15/6/2011
# Log 2h work at 16/6/2011
# Log 2h Back dated work log to 15/6/2011.
# Result: Remaining estimate 4h. Value is correct
|

*Scenario 2*
# Create an issue at 15/6/2011 with Original Estimate 10h. 
# Log 2h work at 15/6/2011
# At 16/6/2011, Log 2h Back dated work log to 15/6/2011. ( *Backdated Work must be log in advance*)
# Log 2h work at 16/6/2011
# Result: Remaining estimate 2h. Value miscalculated and deducted twice.
|

*Summary*
* Only happened when Backdated work logged before current day worklog.
fields.summary: Backdated worklog miscalculate if logged before today worklog

fields.description:
The GreenHopper Task Board widget is a really useful tool for putting together an overview dashboard or wallboard for a client, and on high-resolution screens it works well.

However, if you want to make a dashboard that looks reasonable on smaller screens, and use the 1/3 + 2/3 2-column layout, then the fixed-large-size widgets create a layout that looks broken.

It would be better if either:

 * The sizing of the widgets was more responsive to the size available
 * There was a config option where you could select "small/medium/large" size

I've attached an anonymized screenshot to demonstrate the issue.
fields.summary: Font-size option on "GreenHopper Task Board" dashboard widget

fields.description:
The GreenHopper task board is designed to replace a white board scrum board but we still need to have a physical scrum board for a couple of things, including a *Sprint Calendar*

A scrum/sprint calendar is a common things for any team doing SCRUM, typically teams uses Sprints of 2 to 4 weeks, within the particular Sprint there are a number of events to keep track of when they occur. 

As of now, GreenHopper has a Start Date, End Date and Release Date for every sprint, but they are not visible in an integrated Sprint Calendar.

Depending on the practitioner, the particulars of the calendar will change but will include dates like

* Daily standup time
* Date of feature freeze
* Date of Code freeze
* Demo date
* Product Backlog Planning Date
* Sprint Planning (part 1/2) Date
* Sprint retrospective date

Ideally a Sprint calendar would be integral to Greenhopper and be fully configurable with the milestone dates all present. This would then be vsiisble on a sidebar when the taskbar was in view.

A poor man's version would be an editable textbox which was not integrated to GreenHopper, which one could view with the task board opr even a poorer poor man's as a gadget for the dashboard would help.
fields.summary: Integrated Sprint Calendar

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When viewing issues as lists and showing sub-tasks, sub-tasks are not necessarily kept on the same page as the parent.  (See the attached screen shot).  I would like to suggest that it would be better to display sub-tasks on the same page as the parent, even if it means exceeding the number of issues to be displayed per page.  Either that or provide a toggle that allows for this limit to be exceeded when their are "orphaned" sub-tasks.  Thanks for considering this!

fields.description: For the same release the estimate fields (original, spent & remaining) are adding up differently and giving different numbers in the Agile Gadget on the Dash board and on the Planning board in Greenhopper. This usually happens when the system date is post dated and an additional issue is created with an original estimate. In such case, the gadget is added correctly while the planning board is not incremented causing a discrepancy. Please see the screen-shots.

fields.description:
With Jira 4.3 and GH 5.6/5.6.3 when the field "Epic/Theme" = None (i.e. there is no value specified) for a specific issue, this field is removed altogether from View Issue screen. It is only displayed without values when all existing values are removed using the pop-up window. When the issue view screen is refreshed after that, the field is hidden.

Previously, in Jira 4.1.2 and GH 5.2.4, it was still displayed in View Issue screen with the small edit icon next to it. Clicking on it displayed a pop-up window and values could be added easily.

Steps to reproduce this behavior:

*JIRA 4.3 & GreenHopper 5.6* and *JIRA 4.3.3 & GreenHopper 5.6.4*:
1. Choose a project to test this on and make sure Epic/Theme custom field is configured properly for this project (Administration -> Custom Fields, Administration -> Field Configurations, Administration -> Field Configuration Schemes):
1.1 It has to be included on the correct screen(s)
1.2 Field Configuration Scheme is valid - correct issue type is mapped to correct Field Configuration
1.3 the field is not hidden in the Field Configuration
2. Click Create Issue link in the top left area in Jira
3. Choose the correctly configured project and issue type, click Next
4. Fill in mandatory fields (do not insert a value to Epic/Theme field) and click Create
5. Notice that there is no Epic/Theme field visible in Issue View screen
6. Click Edit, insert a value into Epic/Theme field, click Update
7. Notice that Epic/Theme field is now visible in View Issue screen with the inserted value
8. Click the small pencil icon next to the value in Epic/Theme field
9. In the appeared popup remove all values from this field and click Update
10. Notice the Epic/Theme field is still visible in View Issue screen and 'None' is denoted as its value
11. Refresh the browser
12. Notice that the Epic/Theme field has now disappeared from the View Issue screen

*JIRA 4.1.2 & GreenHopper 5.2.4*:
1. Choose a project to test this on and make sure Epic/Theme custom field is configured properly for this project (Administration -> Custom Fields, Administration -> Field Configurations, Administration -> Field Configuration Schemes):
1.1 It has to be included on the correct screen(s)
1.2 Field Configuration Scheme is valid - correct issue type is mapped to correct Field Configuration
1.3 the field is not hidden in the Field Configuration
2. Click Create Issue link in the top left area in Jira
3. Choose the correctly configured project and issue type, click Next
4. Fill in mandatory fields (do not insert a value to Epic/Theme field) and click Create
5. Notice that the Epic/Theme field *IS* visible (without a value) in Issue View screen and there is a small pencil icon next to it (see the screenshot).

It would make it much easier for the users to add values to Epic/Theme field when the behavior from JIRA 4.1.2 & GH 5.2.4 would be brought back. Can this be done?
fields.summary: As a user I would like to see Epic/Theme field in Issue View screen even when there is no value inserted

fields.description:
Steps to repro:
1. create a workflow step with only one possible destination step
2. set the transition view  to "no view for transition"
3. enable the workflow
4. open the Task Board
5. set the Task Board Mode to "Outline" and the View to "List"
6. click on the Status of the story to update the status
7. change the Task Board Mode to Compact (Kanban)
8. repeat step 6

Observed: 
When you are in Outline mode, clicking on a story's status causes the Transitioning Issue window comes up with just the one destination step. If you change to Compact mode and drag the story over, the window does not come up. 

Expected:
Behavior should be the same in outline and compact mode. The GH transition window should not come up if there is only one destination.
fields.summary: In Outline mode/List view of Task Board, GH "Transitioning Issue" screen displays for top level issues

fields.description:
We use the Greenhopper Agile Gadget on our dashboards to track burndowns for our team.  The chart almost ALWAYS shows incorrect hour amounts.  Please see screenshot of burndown chart next to the filter results gadget based on the same filter.  The remaining estimates don't match.  We've had similar problems with the yellow line showing an incorrect number.

The filter we're using looks like this:
{code}fixVersion = "QA: Sprint 9 - Evil Nine" AND assignee = "john.chandler" ORDER BY resolution DESC, "GreenHopper Ranking" ASC{code}

You'll notice that in the screenshot, the chart shows 4 remaining hours, where you can see in the filter results gadget that there are 7 remaining hours.
fields.summary: Agile Gadget chart shows incorrect hours

fields.description:
In my understanding the "{{Unscheduled}}" means the Product Backlog and each created version the Release Backlog. When I drag&drop all specific issues from "{{Unscheduled}}" to "{{Release 1.0}}" version than the appropriate label will be added and the issue will disappear in the planning list. To plan a sprint i move on to the Release Backlog "{{Release 1.0}}". When i drag&drop an issue from the list to a specific sprint the label will be added but the label "{{Release 1.0}}" wont be removed. So, the issue will not disappear in the Release Backlog. 

h4.Version-Setup
# Release 1.0
## 1.0 Sprint 3
## 1.0 Sprint 2
## 1.0 Sprint 1

h4.Scenario
# I am on the "{{Planning Board}}" page with "{{Version}}" and "{{Unscheduled}}" selected
# I drag&drop issue {{ABC-123}} from "{{Unscheduled}}" to "{{Release 1.0}}"
# I change from "{{Unscheduled}}" to "{{Release 1.0}}" to see the Release Backlog
# I drag&drop issue {{ABC-123}} from "{{Release 1.0}}" to "{{1.0 Sprint 1}}"
fields.summary: Release label won't removed when drag&drop issue to a sprint

fields.description:
{quote}The Shanghai team starts their sprint on Monday. They do the sprint planing meeting and at the end of the meeting they enter the user stories. Since the server is in the US, the date that the ticket will get is Sunday, not Monday. If you are in EMEA, it might be that a few tickets are created on Sunday and a few tickets are created on Monday.
The timezone setting will help here.

It can also be that you have a long planing meeting, and you don't have the time to create the user stories that same day. So you enter them on Tuesday. The charts will use the creation date to calculate the hours, so the workload only comes into play on Tuesday, and not on Monday. 
In this scenario you need to be able to update the creation time. This will solve the previous issue as well.

It can also be that you decide to split a user story for one reason or the other. So you reduce the work for one story and create a new story for the other part. 
If you are in the middle of the sprint, you want to count the workload for the new story as well from the beginning of the sprint. 
I haven't run in to this problem yet, but I can image that this can happen.

Another example is that you have a user story but you can tell what tasks you have to do for the user story. This can happen if you have a spike and and need to do some investigation first.
After the spike you know more and you can add the tasks. Also in this scenario, you might want to let the hours for the tasks count from the beginning of the sprint and not from the date the task was created.{quote}

[Sub-tasks|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Sub-Task] help to a certain extent, but does not cover all situations.
fields.summary: Need the ability to modify the issue creation date within the charts

fields.description:
If you use issue types in a Greenhopper project which have no description, the Released Board cannot be opened: Every time you click the menu item Agile / Released Board the board is not displayed. Instead you see an 505 error.

The log file says:

org.apache.velocity.runtime.exception.ReferenceException: reference : template = /templates/greenhopper/jira/boards/configuration/layouts/list-layout.vm [line 28,column 210] : $action.issueType.description is not a valid reference.

Workaround:
Add a description for every issue type. Then add an arbitrary new issue type and delete it again. The last action is necessary to renew the cache.
fields.summary: Released Board not available if issue type descriptions are missing

fields.description:
When viewing a pie chart by versions, JIRA shows ALL versions without a chance to pick the root versions or the sub-versions. So the issue count is misleading as it includes the root versions and the sub-versions

e.g. if a parent issue  has 41 issues
and child (a child of parent) which has 24
So on the pie chart we get 2 segments - one for 41 and one for 24, even though the 24 are already included in the 41.

Ideally it should allow you to report on the child level (by selecting the child versions) or at the parent level (by selecting the parents) or both.
fields.summary: Pie chart when configured for version statistic type should allow the option to choose version level

It seems some of the vital editing functions of specific fields within Greenhopper have been degraded.  For example, I keep "reporter" and "assignee" showing on my "list view". fields.description:
COS
- Option "Create Rapid View" in the Views DD of the Issue Navigator
- When clicked the user is taken to the Rapid Board with a temporary Rapid View
- The temporary Rapid View includes a column for each status currently in use, based upon the workflow
- Option to Save the temporary Rapid View is provided at the top where the Configure link usually lives if they are an Admin
- Save option on Rapid View takes the user to the Manage Rapid Views page with the name field highlighted
fields.summary: As a user I would like the ability to Create a Rapid View from the Views drop down on the Issue Navigator
